item.title: When Corporations Kill - Progressive Roundtable
item.description:
When Corporations Kill - Progressive Roundtable

Alex Lawson, Social Security Works & Sarah Badawi, Progressive Change Campaign Committee (PCCC) join Thom. Plus Special Panel Guest - Patty Lovera, Food & Water Watch. The Department of Justice is launching an investigation into the Dole Food company - one of the world's largest processors of fresh produce.

item.title: Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires
item.description:
Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires

Thirty years after the Chernobyl disaster, firefighters remain on high alert to prevent radioactive forest fires. Originally published at - http://www.rferl.org/media/video/guarding-against-chernobyls-radioactive-forest-fires/27691519.html

item.title: A Turning Point for China?
item.description:
A Turning Point for China?

In this film, William Nee discusses what it's like doing human rights work in China today, and tells the story of Pu Zhiqiang, one of China's most famous fre...

item.title: Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square
item.description:
Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square

Performance artist Roman Roslovtsev returned to Red Square to stage his latest masked protest against Russian President Vladimir Putin and a law on public ga...

item.title: US Government Bans e-Cigarette Sales to Minors
item.description:
US Government Bans e-Cigarette Sales to Minors

The U.S. Food and Drug Administration is banning the sale of e-cigarettes and some other tobacco products to people under age 18 for the first time, a move designed to prevent a new generation from being addicted to nicotine. In addition to e-cigarettes, the FDA announced a ban on the sale of pipe tobacco, hookah tobacco and cigars to minors.

item.title: Greek Workers Embark on Weekend Strike Over Austerity Measures
item.description:
Greek Workers Embark on Weekend Strike Over Austerity Measures

Workers in Greece walked off their jobs Friday in protest of new tax and pension reforms being considered by the government that workers say will cut deeply into their incomes. The government's austerity measures are part of a multi-billion-dollar international bailout agreement.

item.title: SpaceX Successfully Lands Rocket
item.description:
SpaceX Successfully Lands Rocket

SpaceX has once again successfully landed a booster rocket on an ocean platform. The feat was accomplished after the rocket deployed a Japanese communication satellite into orbit. The unmanned Falcon 9 rocket landed early Friday on a platform in the Atlantic Ocean off the southeastern U.S. coast of Florida.

item.title: In Banja Luka, A Mosque Rises From The Rubble
item.description:
In Banja Luka, A Mosque Rises From The Rubble

In the middle of the night on May 7, 1993, the centuries-old Ferhadija Mosque in Bosnia-Herzegovina's city of Banja Luka was blown up. A few minutes later, there was another explosion, this time in the city's second mosque, Arnautija. The two buildings were completely destroyed.
